Explanations about Options.-P(M):
Specifies the port to connect to on the remote host. Note that this option is
 written with a capital ‘P’, because -p is already reserved for preserving the times
 and modes of the file.

Explanations about Options.-X(C): ssh -X In the server you need an ssh server, for example "openssh-server" and at least some basic X tools, for example "xinit" and "fluxbox" (and the programs and libraries that they need).
Explanations about Options.-X(M):
Enables X11 forwarding. This can also be specified on a per-host basis in a
 configuration file.

Explanations about Options.-i(M):
Use only the key(s) contained in identity_file (rather than looking for identities
 via ssh-add(1) or in the default_ID_file). If the filename does not end in .pub
 this is added. If the filename is omitted, the default_ID_file is used.
